security: Releasing the association of "Aquatic" with photo operations in Mexico City is already compromised as it has been released in documents at NARA. Further releases without demonstrating 'current harm' would not be protected.
summary: J. Barry Harrelson informs Teresa Wilcox about the status of 'Aquatic' slug line protection and the ARRB's stance on its release in documents, particularly concerning photo operations in Mexico City, advising her on the necessity of proving 'current harm' for continued protection and suggesting review options for related files.
summary_one_paragraph: In a memo dated August 1, 1998, J. Barry Harrelson advises Teresa Wilcox (DST) regarding the 'Aquatic' slug line, noting the Agency's agreement in 1995 to release slug lines and the ARRB's current requirement for demonstrating 'current harm' to prevent further releases. Harrelson clarifies that 'Aquatic', used in documents about photo operations in Mexico City, has already been released at NARA. He also mentions a specific document about Cuban passport fabrication and offers options for review, including a DS&T look by Tony F. and in-person review at IP, and copied Eileen M. Wukitch (DO) and James R. Oliver (DA).
title: Re: Slug (AQUATIC)
